Literature Review: Cryo-electron tomography has revolutionized the field of cell biology by providing a unique opportunity to study the structure of cells in their native environment. The technique has undergone significant improvements in the past decade, enabling researchers to visualize macromolecular networks in near-native conditions. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current state of cryo-electron tomography, its applications in in situ structural biology, and its potential to advance our understanding of structure-function relationships in cells.
